Pre-Game Insights: Manager Alex Cora switched up the routine on Tuesday, cutting back on the pregame work for his players. That seemed to do the trick as the Red Sox responded with a 6-3 win over the Blue Jays.
The victory snapped a four-game losing streak.
Rafael Devers was out of the lineup for Tuesday night’s win with shoulder soreness and is out again tonight.
Lineups: BLUE JAYS: Springer RF, Varsho CF, Guerrero Jr. 1B, Horwitz DH, Barger 3B, Kirk C, Loperfido LF, Clement SS, Wagner 2B.
RED SOX: Duran CF, Hamilton 2B, O’Neill LF, Casas 1B, Abreu RF, Yoshida DH, Wong C, Gonzalez 3B, Rafaela SS.
